thread.title: Perth Lord Mayor admits breaching rules over gifts, travel
thread.title_full: Perth Lord Mayor admits breaching rules over gifts, travel

author: Charlotte Hamlyn
title: Perth Lord Mayor admits breaching rules over gifts, travel
text:
Map: Perth 6000 
Perth Lord Mayor Lisa Scaffidi has admitted five breaches of the Local Government Act during a State Administrative Tribunal (SAT) hearing investigating whether she failed to disclose travel-related gifts and contributions. 
Ms Scaffidi is facing 45 allegations she committed "serious breaches" of the act by accepting gifts and travel, including a trip to the 2008 Beijing Olympics funded by BHP Billiton. 
Her Lawyer Stephen Penglis told the hearing his client admitted to a total of five breaches, including the flights and accommodation associated with the Beijing trip. 
Ms Scaffidi also admitted to breaching the act by accepting three nights' accommodation at Broome's Cable Beach Club in 2008, as well as a hospitality package for a 2009 concert at Leeuwin. 
Mr Penglis asked that those breaches be set aside, but said the nature of dozens of others would be challenged. 
"This is not a case of intentional non-disclosure with a view to misleading," he told the SAT. 
"This hearing involves the proper characterisation of largely undisputed facts." 
Mr Penglis said the legal argument would centre around the definitions of "gift" and "contributions to travel", and what information was required to be disclosed in each instance. Mayor followed sister city visit rules: CEO 
The SAT also heard from former City of Perth chief executive Frank Edwards. 
He was quizzed about other trips taken by the Lord Mayor to Perth sister cities, and whether the Lord Mayor should have made disclosures beyond those made by her. 
Mr Edwards said specific policies surrounding sister city visits had been followed. 
The action by the Department of Local Government (DLG) comes after a damning report from the Corruption and Crime Commission in November 2015 . 
The CCC investigated the $US36,000 trip Ms Scaffidi took to the Beijing Olympics, and found she had "failed in her duties" by not disclosing the funds in her annual return, along with other gifts and travel. 
That report prompted an inquiry by the director-general of the DLG, which found Ms Scaffidi failed to properly disclose gifts and contributions on multiple occasions between January 2008 and October 2015. 
That highly critical report recommended she be referred to the SAT. 
Ms Scaffidi, who has been on the council since 2000, has repeatedly refused to stand down , saying her failure to properly disclose gifts was the result of flawed City of Perth guidelines and policies. More on this story:
